pain_points.description: Same here! I never know what to make and by the time lunch rolls around I'm too hungry to think.
pain_points.quote: Same here! I never know what to make and by the time lunch rolls around I'm too hungry to think. So I just grab whatever is easiest, which is usually junk food or expensive delivery.

pain_points.description: I tried meal prepping on Sundays but by Wednesday I'm sick of eating the same thing.
pain_points.quote: I tried meal prepping on Sundays but by Wednesday I'm sick of eating the same thing. Plus I don't have a big enough fridge to store everything.

pain_points.description: YES! I either skip meals completely because I'm in the zone working, or I'm constantly snacking.
pain_points.quote: YES! I either skip meals completely because I'm in the zone working, or I'm constantly snacking. There's no in-between. The structure of office life helped regulate my eating.

pain_points.description: Lack of meal planning leads to unhealthy food choices and expensive takeout orders
pain_points.quote: I never know what to make and by the time lunch rolls around I'm too hungry to think. So I just grab whatever is easiest, which is usually junk food or expensive delivery.

pain_points.description: Decision fatigue from having to plan every meal while working from home
pain_points.quote: The mental load of deciding what to eat three times a day on top of work is exhausting. I never realized how much cognitive energy goes into meal planning.

pain_points.description: Food waste from buying groceries without proper planning or recipes
pain_points.quote: I waste so much food because I buy groceries with good intentions but then don't use them. Vegetables go bad before I get around to cooking them.
